content: romantical socks by meaghan schmaltz the story simply put - it s valentine s day and i have a beautiful skein of yarn so why not make something pretty and well socks materials candy skein yummy fingering fingering weight 75% merino wool 25% nylon superwash 465 yds/100g skein 1 skein candy apple crush colorway us 1 2 25mm 32 circular needle or dpns stitch markers tapestry needle finished sizes small medium and large 7¼ 8¼ and 9⅛ inches circumference recommended fit 1-inch of negative ease gauge 35 sts and 47 row = 4 in stockinette notes these socks are worked one at a time from the top down using the stitch glossary magic loop method and a modified eye of partridge gusset heel beg - beginning decrease - decreased written and charted instructions are provided k - knit k2tog - knit two stitches together adjust needle size as necessary to match gauge p - purl p2tog - purl 2 stitches together the chart only indicates the sts on the front/instep of the sock all rem - remain s back/sole sts will be worked in stockinette repeat - repeat round s - round s these socks are identical to one another knit two to make a pair rs - right side of work facing you sl - slip st from left to right needle wyib in case of using dpns assume that the front needle is synonymous sl2kpsso - slip 2 sts k1 pass slipped sts over the knit st with needles 1 & 2 and that the back needle is synonymous with sm - slip marker needles 3 & 4 ssk- slip 1 st knitwise slip a second st knitwise move these 2 sts back to the left needle and k2tog tbl slip all sts purlwise unless otherwise noted st / sts - stitch / stitches tbl - through back loop s ws - wrong side of work facing you wyib - with yarn in back of work yo - yarn over if you find any errors or have any questions please feel free to email me directly meaghan@unapologeticknitter com page 1 of 3 @notsorryknitter on ravelry instagram ello & twitter | unapologeticknitter com | the unapologetic knitter on facebook & youtube cuff heel flap work the gusset cast on 64 72 80 sts loosely using your preferred method with ws facing and knitting flat on the back needle round 1 needle 1 knit to 2 sts before marker ssk sm work divide the sts evenly place the first 32 36 40 sts on the front row 1 ws k3 purl to end of row across 16 18 20 instep sts in established pattern needle - these will be the front/instep sts the last 32 36 40 sts row 2 rs p3 *k1 sl 1 repeat from * to last 3 sts k3 round 1 needle 2 work across 16 18 20 instep sts in will be the back/sole sts and will be worked on the back needle row 3
